Description: Ivory carving of a royal bodyguard; on the left is a royal bodyguard with carved bow, tasselled quiver, and neatly laced sandals; figures in front include the king and a winged spirit; the lotus and bud pattern was derived from Egypt.
Bibliographic references: Barnett & Davies 1975a / A catalogue of Nimrud ivories with other examples of Ancient Near Eastern Ivories (V.6; pl. CXXI)
